job_title: Executive Director Communications in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Supportive/inclusive work environment. Top leadership understands day-to-day challenges and opportunities. Mission-driven, nonprofit. No owners or stockholders to make richer; all the money generated is put back into people and campuses.
cons: I have been here 9 years and am excited about the future of the company. No complaints.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Lots of options for type of shift (FT PT Flex WOW, etc) great for students looking for opportunity
cons: Base pay needs to be increased, not very organized, can be difficult for those who just graduated but you learn the ins and outs of the field. If you can make it here you’re good

job_title: Director of Maintenance and Operations in West Pittsburg, PA
pros: The residents and co-workers were great.

review_title: Sometimes "doing it for the residents" just isn't enough.
pros: The only pros are the relationships built with fellow staff and working with the residents.
cons:
I wouldn't have the time in a day to explain the cons of this place, but I'll try (in list format, for brevity). 

1. Communication? Never heard of her. 
2. Upper management and HR (no fault to HR, they are literally there to protect middle and upper-management, so kudos to them) protect managers who continually cause problems with both employees and resident family members alike. 
3. Hypocracy- lower level employees will get fired for doing something once that a middle to upper-management employee will get away with for years, albeit to the detriment of thier department.
4. The place is literally run like what I would imagine a high-school clique would deem acceptable practices lots of gossip, gossip, and more (you guessed it) gossip!

I have never worked somewhere as toxic as this place. I would enter and exit the building with a veil of anxiety over my shoulders. The behavior and unprofessional attitude of the activities dept. head was absolutely abhorrent. I do not wish this boss upon anyone.

Do yourself a favor and hit the skip button on this one.

pros: None.  Have to wonder about all the "good reviews" on here.  Most likely from Management trying to save the company from bad reviews
cons: Everything.  mismanagement abounds in this organization.  They hide behind a "charity organization"  yet run it the complete opposite

pros: Efficient and organized. Your opinion matters. Lots of room for growth and great people to work with.
cons: Pay is ok. Not very competitive

pros: My supervisor was amazing and very supportive
cons: During the pandemic, we were furloughed with no updates as time went on (due to renovation construction)

pros:
Vincentian has been a really pleasant surprise. I've worked in health care all over Pittsburgh, and the team here - leadership and staff - is very engaged in providing great care for residents, and for staff, too.  A proactive vs. reactive organization. They are forging into the future instead of trying to navigate obstacles.  it is a refreshing approach - more innovative than most. 
I've been here just over a year, and in that time they have done renovations to all facilities, and come up with new programs for staff, like wellness and leadership development.  People here are very committed to what they do. Working hard  is expected, and for the right reasons.  But, work life balance is also important here. Yes, the expectation is high, but the respect for family life is also strong. 
Overall, a really positive culture and you feel like you are part of something good that is making a difference.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Pgh Int ArPort, PA
pros: Adequate staffing Only Skilled Facility I've seen that employees a 3-11 admission nurse. Nurse to resident ratio good . New skilled units w modern family style kitchens  Staff eats with residents and /or families /friends too. Unit clerks on every unit on 7-3 .
cons: Supervisors did not assist nurses on the floor at all even when asked to help or even give advice. Only nurses and Cnas that were in the cliche were treated well

review_title: Constant Turmoil, Financial Distress, Always short-staffed
pros: Time off policies were good, most fellow nursing staff truly cared,
cons: Poor employee morale, inability to staff due to staffing model that was created by a CEO and not a nurse, pay was average to below average, benefits were above average until the end of 2014, top management are completely of out of touch and incompetent, mission and values are a joke, organization in financial distress,  many good workers were fired for no reason or because top management just didn't like them

review_title: please treat employees with some respect
pros: it is close to home ,free parking
cons: complete lack of recognition of hard work,'merit' raises of 10 cents an hour no cost of living raise, no communication to staff, refusal of administration to call an ambulance for workers hurt or ill on the job,pressure to skip meal breaks or any breaks, no formal application or notice of job openings ,supervisors unwilling to reply to worker inquiries or to get their hands dirty ,logical thinking or staff input strongly discouraged  I could go on for a lot longer.

pros: The company offers good benefits and it is a friendly environment to work in. There are also plenty of opportunities to gain experience in the field.
cons: The company is non-profit so there is not a lot of extra money. Salaries are lower than equivalent for-profit companies but they make up for that in added benefits to employees.

pros: Good team work on each unit on night shift.
cons: Poor Pay, very poor staffing, no administrative support amongst their own peers and towards staff. No compassion!

pros: The residents are great, they made the job worthwhile.
cons: Poor management, a very toxic environment to work in. There was definitely favoritism that occurs. They want a college degree for the job but pay $12 an hour.
Unequal treatment of employees, no support from nursing administration,poor staffing,lying by administration a constant. CEO that openly dislikes nursing,complete abandonment of Mission values.

review_title: The long-standing employees hold the place together.
cons: HR shows a clear bias/preference for a select group of employees. Also, short staffed as a rule.

pros: Pay is decent, good job perks, other staff and administrator very friendly
cons: Ill have to update on this
Long days due to the nature of the job.
